page.title: 11KEEPING THE PEACE IN YALDING
page.content: The area is policed from Maidstone, although a constable and his family live in a police house at Yalding. The constable's duties extend to Maidstone and local villages, often on motorcycle patrol. During the 1984/85 miners' strike he helped police pickets in the Midlands and Kent coalfields. Two areas cause local concern, the activities of some local youths and the behaviour of some casual labourers. Seasonal work with fruit and hops has traditionally seen labour employed from outside the village, some of the workers being itinerants termed "travellers". On some summer Saturday evenings double police patrols have sometimes been provided. This summer farmers are encouraging more local people to help with fruit picking.
